title: Identify Energy Exchange
text: Consider that energy is exchanged between the copper block and the water until they reach a thermal equilibrium. The heat lost by the copper equals the heat gained by the water. How can this idea help in finding the final temperature?

title: Use the Heat Transfer Equation
text:
Since no heat is lost to the surroundings, apply the formula $$q=mcΔT$$ separately for the copper and the water, knowing that $$q_{copper}$$ (heat lost by $$copper)=-q_{water}$$ (heat gained by water). Set up the equation:

$$150$$ × 0.385(T_f - 80) $$=$$ $$-300$$ × 4.18(T_f - 25)

Where
$$T_f$$ is the final temperature in °C. Simplify and solve for $$T_f$$.

title: Convert to Kelvin
text: Once you find the final temperature in Celsius, remember to convert it to Kelvin. The conversion formula is: $$T_K$$ $$=$$ $$T_C$$ + $$273.15$$. Don’t forget to round your answer to the nearest integer.
